reviews.review_msg: The topics he chose in this course were very interesting and he explains the concepts in a very easily understandable way. Otherwise, it is distance ed so the only contact you have is with the tutor marker. Assignments were fun to do and I thoroughly enjoyed learning about natural disasters. I wish some assignments were better explained.

Took this course in distance format. He gave very very very tough exams especially the final exam. Exams are irrelevant to both the textbook and his notes. I survived because we have an easy marker. Midterm avg was like 62% and I think he scaled the final exam a lot . Not recommend this prof for a first year prof

Glyn loves to talk about his research which I found super interesting. Course content was simple enough and interesting, but the lab content was really tough, so give yourself lots of time to study for that! Lectures posted online so was okay missing some lectures, but emphasizes stuff on exams so it's helpful to attend. By and large loved it!

Lectures give you the general gist. Textbook is optional but still useful. Overall a course on the harder side due to a small number of people who are actually interested in GEOLOGY. It's not hard if you're either interested or study hard. The reason it's hard for the majority is prob b/c they expect to learn the basics and not the mechanisms.

Glyn is a real caring professor. He tries to encourage his students and calm their nerves before exams by giving advice and telling his students to follow their instincts. He's really caring, gives good feedback on assignments, and is understanding. Would take this class again.
Lectures are far from boring. Lots of interesting conversation. He is very enthusiastic about what he teaches. Very open to help you succeed.

I took this class after having taken one of Glyn's other classes, having enjoyed having him as a professor. This class was definitely harder. The grading is pretty straight forward- two midterms and a cumulative final, all multiple choice. You definitely need to pay attention in lecture, as the slides alone won't do it. Still a great prof.

Glyn is an amazing prof, with a clear passion for volcanology.  He has a great sense of humour.  EASC 421 has a really cool field trip to Mt. Meager.  Lab assignments are shorter than other EASC classes.  One lab period is an interactive, realistic volcanic disaster-response simulation which was unlike anything I'd done before.  Great class!

A really good professor, Glyn is obviously very interested in the topic, encourages questions, and is easy to contact. There was no textbook necessary, which was great, and he provided links for videos and what not that had to do with the class. Tests are all multiple choice, so be sure to study a lot, as the questions sometimes leave you wondering
awesome professor! very passionate and helpful. he was very clear with what would be on midterm and final. pay attention and you are good to go. always there for help. i recommend his class

I took this course as my 2nd elective course. Don`t take this course, if you dont need it.completly useless.it is even harder than any 4th year Ensc course.Professor thinks he is teaching quantum physics and he is trying too hard to show that the course is really Important . Just don't take this course if you don't need it.trust me

Awesome prof.  Very passionate about the subject and makes you want to know more!  He is energetic in lecture and a very intelligent dude.  Always available for help, answers questions thoroughly and in a way you can understand!  I would take another class with him in a second.

great prof. very helpful and he tries to help whenever he can. since the midterm mark was really low, he gave students the option to combine the midterm percentile with the final... not many profs will give a second chance like he does

absolutely amazing prof. he was very enthusiastic and clear in lectures. this is certainly not a course you can breeze through unless you took geology in highschool but both himself and the ta's are very helpful. i recommend taking any course with this guy because he doesnt bs you and he's also really friendly
He is very interested in what he teaches and very willing to explain things you do not understand. His midterm will be the end of your mark though.

I really enjoyed this class, though it is my interest. He has a clear passion for what he does, and is always willing to help you. I'd take another class with him NO PROBLEM! In fact, I am! Text wasn't used all that much, just take good notes and pay attention and you'll be fine!

Good prof. Don't take Easc101 thinking it's an easy course. It's not. i got pwned. The course itself is boring and useless if you arent pursuring geology. I got a C in this class. The labs were 80% guesswork imo. I wouldnt recommend anyone to take this course. 104 may be more interesting however.

after getting our mt marks back, I was very surprised, as was everyone else b/c almost everyone did bad.  But, he is a good prof and keeps it as interesting as he can.  u can replace ur mark w/the final, & thank god for dat!  to do good on mt or final, study notes & the textbook. IT'LL HELP!
Good teacher but the exams are very hard.  You have to memorize the whole textbook to do well on the midterm and final.
more than 60% get less than 50% on his miterm. very hard!!!!!!!
This prof did a horrible job preparing us for the midterm. And he did a horrible job preparing us for the final exam as well.
it is easy to understand his lecture,but the notes are useless for the exam. the exam is very very hard. do not just read the notes before you go to the exam.Read the book and remember everything.

While he is a clear, charismatic teacher with good presentations his notes are near useless and his exams are horrific.  There was a 56% average on his mid-term with a high failure rate.  Unless you can memorize an entire textbook and over 200 pages of notes steer well clear of this GPA killer.

well, he is a nice guy who tells funny jokes here and there but I can't say he is the best prof. He gives very little information regarding exams if any at all. His notes are very brief and made for the purpose of him lecturing. Exams are consisted of mc, sh/long answers and diagrams.. very demanding I say. taking it as an elective?! - BAD IDEA!!
GOOD

Glyn is one of the best prof I have had here at SFU, so good the idea of being a grad student with him studing volcanos almost changed my major. I would take all of his classes if I could. Awesome prof, knows his stuff, great guy all round. SFU should give him a raise.
Awesome prof. Great lecture, great stories. He's just a great teacher, he gets the point across, and he makes it easy to learn.
Great guy to talk with, always has neat stories about volcanoes and travelling in foreign countries.  Looks like Mr. Bean though, which is distracting at times.  Good prof.
This guy's a great prof. His exams are pretty easy, and makes lectures fun by using humour. Just watch out for the disaster log in this class...it requires a lot of work.
Great and enthusiastic!
